Generation IV.Diamond: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
Generation IV.Pearl: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.
Generation IV.Platinum: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit poisonous, is a significant ingredient in remedies for lower-back HG /lower back SS pain.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit poisonous, is a significant ingredient in remedies for lower-back HG /lower back SS pain.

Generation VIII.Sword: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
Generation VIII.Shield: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It inflates its poison sacs and makes a blubbering sound to intimidate foes.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
Generation IX.Violet: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
